title: Ranked is ruined by teamkilling
self_text: Teamkilling in ranked has gotten out of control, people are inting on purpose and it's a huge issue for anyone trying to climb the ranks. It ruins the game and discourages people from playing ranked. I was about to hit gold but lost a bunch of rank due to teamkilling in my games.  I think there needs to be bigger penalties for teamkilling in ranked so that people don't do it anymore. Maybe they should implement a system where if you teamkill someone, you get banned for a certain amount of time depending on how many times you have done it before.  What do you guys think?

title: Is there any way to delete an item from my inventory without dropping it?
self_text: I'm trying to get rid of a bunch of items in my inventory, but the game won't let me select them for deletion. I need to drop them first and then pick them up again before being able to delete them, which is really annoying.

title: Anyone else think the new story arc is going to be a big deal?
self_text: I've been thinking about it, and I have a really weird theory.  I know everyone thinks that the villain of this story arc will probably be some random evil god from outer space or something like that, but what if it's actually... The Four?!   I mean, they were introduced in the last story arc as being pretty powerful, so maybe they're not just minor villains. And considering how much focus has been put on them lately, it wouldn't surprise me if they turned out to be the main antagonists.  Also, remember when we first learned about the Four, they didn't seem like they had any goals at all other than causing chaos and destruction. But now, they're starting to show more signs of having a larger plan. Maybe they're trying to build an army or take over the world or something!   I know it sounds crazy, but I can't shake the feeling that the Four are going to play a bigger role in this story arc than anyone expects. What do you guys think?

self_text: I've been thinking about getting the new battle pass but am not sure if its worth buying. Any thoughts?

title: How many times did you guys get a win by being in the back?
self_text: I have been playing ranked for over two years and i've never gotten a win as a support or mage without getting at least one kill, but i'm curious to know if that is rare or not.  I'm asking because i'm tired of losing with people who stay in the back and just poke from there all game long.  Sure it can be effective sometimes but when they don't do anything else they are essentially useless.

title: Why does my game have so many players who just run around without doing anything?
self_text: I'm playing with my friends in a lobby and we keep getting matched with people who just walk around the map, don't do objectives or try to win at all. They also don't use their weapons and it makes it really hard for us to play properly. Is there something going on with this?  I feel like if you can't even bother to move around or shoot you shouldn't be queueing into competitive. It's been happening more often since I got back into Overwatch after not playing for a long time.

title: New DLC Ideas
self_text: Hey everyone, I’m here to share some ideas for future DLC that could add new content and features to the game.  1.   The “Wanderer” DLC - This DLC would introduce a nomadic faction of people who travel around in caravans, trading goods and offering services. Players could join this faction or interact with them as traders and allies. The DLC could include new caravan routes, unique items, and quests related to the Wanderer faction.  2.   The “Coastal Kingdoms” DLC - This DLC would focus on expanding the coastal regions of the game, introducing new settlements, factions, and challenges. Players could build their own coastal cities, engage in naval warfare, and explore hidden islands and ruins. The DLC could also introduce new ship types, trade routes, and resources.  3.   The “Lost Civilizations” DLC - This DLC would delve into the history of the world, uncovering ancient civilizations and lost technologies. Players could embark on archaeological expeditions, decipher ancient texts, and uncover powerful artifacts. The DLC could introduce new questlines, dungeons, and enemies based on these lost civilizations.  4.   The “Crafting Overhaul” DLC - This DLC would revamp the crafting system, adding more depth and complexity. Players could specialize in different crafting professions, create unique items, and establish crafting guilds. The DLC could also introduce new recipes, materials, and tools.  5.   The “Political Intrigue” DLC - This DLC would expand the political aspects of the game, allowing players to engage in complex schemes, form alliances, and manipulate factions. Players could become spymasters, orchestrate coups, and influence the course of history. The DLC could introduce new characters, events, and consequences based on player choices.  These are just a few ideas, but I believe they could add a lot of value to the game. What do you think? Let me know your thoughts and suggestions!

title: Can you get banned for a game that has been retired?
self_text: I have an account that was permanently banned for using the cheat engine on the now-retired game, Plants vs Zombies: Garden Warfare 2. The ban only applies to that game and does not affect my other EA titles. Now, I got invited by a friend to play Battlefield V, but when I tried playing with him, he said I was still unable to join his squad due to me being banned in EA. Is this normal? What can I do about it?

title: How to deal with a team that is only focused on shooting the enemy and not playing objective?
self_text: I'm tired of playing ranked when my teammates don't care about winning and just want to get their kill/death ratio up, especially when they are losing or we are being stomped. I tried explaining them that it doesn't matter if you get lots of kills if you aren't capturing objectives but nothing works. It's so frustrating as a support main who tries to help the team win. Does anyone have any advice for dealing with this situation?  I think maybe I need to stop playing ranked until I find some friends to play with.

title: Best gear for a dark mage?
self_text: I'm looking to make an awesome dark mage, what gear should I go for?  I want to be able to cast spells like firebolt and frostbite at high damage but also survive in melee range so i can use things like arcane blast or even just my sword if need be.   Should i focus on armor? Or weapons? Or both?

title: I think I figured out the reason why people are so angry at this game
self_text: People get angry when they expect something and don't get it, right? Like if you go to a restaurant and order steak but they give you chicken. Well that's how most players feel about Hogwarts Legacy, as they were expecting a RPG similar to Skyrim or Fallout where you can do what ever you want and become who ever you want, but instead they got a "Harry Potter theme park" where you follow the story line and there isn't much room for creativity or choice.   So yes, the game is beautiful and fun, but in my opinion it has failed to deliver on what players wanted.  What do you guys think?

title: Rant about the new design of the game
self_text: I hate it so much, i don't even know what they did but everything looks worse and is clunky and just ugly af.  I understand that a redesign can be good but this isn't good at all.

title: I wish for a more advanced form of the Command function in the game.
self_text: The Command function is really useful, but it's too basic, it only has like two commands, and there are no options to set up your own commands, or even copy them from others!  I have some ideas for that -   * A UI where you can add a command with its name and description * A way to set multiple actions on one command (like "Say X then do Y") * Copy/Paste Commands between characters * Share commands so other players can use them (or import them) * Some kind of chat command log  And of course, if possible, let us define our own variables to be used in the commands (for example,  "/command giveitem [player] [item]" would need a variable for both player and item.)

title: I'm looking for a good game to play with my friends
self_text: Hey guys! I need help finding a game that is fun and interesting, and that has a community of players who are willing to team up.  I have played the following games: - League of Legends - Fortnite - Overwatch 2 - Valorant - CSGO - Apex Legends - Paladins - Team Fortress 2 - Minecraft - Among Us - Rocket League - Destiny 2 - Battlefield V - Halo Infinite - Call of Duty   And I am open to other suggestions as well. Thanks for your time!

title: Am I the only one who thinks that the next season should be about the aftermath of the war?
self_text: With all the things we saw at the end of the last season, it's very obvious that there will be a lot to unpack in the upcoming episodes. We have so many questions that need answering and I think that it would make sense for the show to focus on the characters as they try to recover from everything that happened during the war.  I want to see how everyone is dealing with the fact that they lost friends and family members. I also want to know what happens to those who were involved in the final battle. Do they get rewarded for their services or do they face consequences for their actions? It seems like there are so many possibilities for the writers to explore and I really hope they don't waste them by rushing into another big conflict right away.

title: How does a player get to be a champion?
self_text: I understand how someone becomes an archon, but it's not mentioned in the lore how anyone gets to become a champion of their god. Is there anything about that somewhere or is it just assumed when you've done great deeds for them they give you their blessing and make you into a champion?  Is it even possible for players to become champions or are only NPCs allowed to reach this level of power?

I was thinking about making a weapon with unique perks like +10% damage vs robots and -5% against humans, but that would be impossible without creating a whole new item.  Can anyone help me out?  I'd also love to hear your thoughts on how to go about doing this.

Would that be possible for a game like this?  I think it would really help the longevity of the game, and make it more fun!

title: Ranked Mode - Ranked League/Division Changes?
self_text: I've been a regular in ranked mode for about the last year and a half, but haven't played for about a month because of work and school.  I just hopped on to play some competitive matches after my break, but something seems off with the way league/division changes work now.  When I used to take breaks, I would come back and be able to see that my ranking hadn't changed since I left (e.g. Diamond II).  Now, when I came back today, it looks like I was demoted down to Platinum IV while not playing at all.   Is anyone else experiencing this issue?  Did they change how division decay works or is there another reason why this is happening?

My current class is a Paladin (Oath of Vengeance) with around level 10. title: What if the empire had a fleet of Imperial Knights?
self_text: The Empire and the Republic both have legions of soldiers, but neither has anything like the giant robots of the Imperium. I'm not saying they should be used as shock troopers, but just having a few dozen walking tanks on the battlefield would change everything.  The Imperial Navy is strong in space, but when it comes to ground warfare... well we know how that turned out at Crait.

I understand that they want to introduce new characters and explore new corners of the galaxy, but they also know just how much people love Shepard.  So what do you guys think? Will we see a story expansion where we get to play as Shepard again? Or are they planning on keeping Shepard in the past with the revamp?

title: I think I have an idea for a new character!
self_text: This is just me brainstorming and I need some feedback, so please be honest with your thoughts.  The name of my character will be Arlo Stardust. He's a male human who has the ability to create objects from stardust. The bigger/more complex the object, the more stamina he uses. Also, if he overuses his power, he can get very sick and tired. His main goal in life is to prove himself as a hero, but he doesn't know how to use his powers properly yet.  I was thinking that Arlo would be the son of a legendary hero who died saving the world, which could lead to him feeling like he needs to live up to his father's legacy. Or maybe he's just someone trying to find their place in the world.  What do you guys think? Any ideas or suggestions are welcome!

title: I think the story of the game is really well done, but some of the characters are just terrible and don't fit in
self_text: It's a weird situation with the story of this game. The story is great and I can easily see why people would love it, but so many of the characters seem to be there to be annoying or have little personality.  I understand that they want to make the characters flawed, but they feel more like they were designed to irritate you than anything else.

title: Does anyone know what the difference between the two?
self_text: I was just browsing through the store and noticed there were two different versions of the same item available, both for the exact same price. I'm really confused as to why they would do that.

title: Why do people still use the term "smurf"?
self_text: I've seen a lot of posts complaining about smurfs, and I never understood why people would even bother to make a new account if they were that good at the game. It just seems like it'd be a waste of time and effort for something so pointless.

title: Ranked Play
self_text: I'm not a big fan of the game being competitive, but as it is now the game doesn't feel like it has any progression to it.  I don't have anything to work towards and just go into quick play and do whatever I want.   I think if there was some sort of ranked play mode that rewards you for winning in a way that feels meaningful it would be good for the game.  Like a badge or something, or even unlocking things that can only be unlocked through ranked.  It could also add more player retention to the game, since people will keep coming back to climb the ranks.

title: Anyone else think the new items are too easy to get?
self_text: I just beat a few bosses in less than an hour, and got three legendary items, two of which were useful for my build.  I understand that they want to make it more accessible but I feel like it's too easy now.  What do you guys think?

title: Can you do a challenge where you don't use any of the special items?
self_text: I was thinking about doing a challenge on Minecraft but I didn't know what to base it off so I thought, "What if I didn't use any of the special items?" and then I came up with this idea! So I want to see people try this challenge out.  I would like to see all your results in the comments!

title: Question about the “Eldest Son” quest in Hearthstone’s Book of Heroes Galakrond adventure
self_text: I am stuck on the final stage of the “Eldest Son” quest, where you have to defeat the boss with your hero power at least three times. The problem is that every time I try to do so, it just keeps summoning more minions and the only way to win is by using my cards, but then I don’t fulfill the requirement of doing so with my hero power. I tried looking up a video for help, but couldn't find anything related to this specific issue.  Can anyone help me out?

title: I just got a code for the game from my friend! He said he doesn’t want it anymore and gave me the key for free, so I am very grateful. :D
self_text: I don’t have any expectation to this game but maybe it will be good? 🤔

title: What is the best way to get a new account for RF Online?
self_text: Hi, I am looking for the best way to make an account on RF Online. My old account has been banned and now I want to play again but my email address is blocked from making any new accounts so what do you guys recommend?

title: Why do people use the term “dumpster fire” to describe something bad?
self_text: I’m genuinely curious about the origins of that phrase and how it became so popular.  I know a dumpster is a trash can, but what does that have to do with things being bad?

title: What is the best way to get a good character in D&D?
self_text: I have been thinking about how to make characters for my upcoming campaign and would like some advice on making a fun, useful, impactful character!  I'm really interested in what you guys think makes a great character.  For me it's story and roleplaying.  What about you?

title: Need a recommendation for a great single player game on the Switch, I’m bored of Zelda.
self_text: My brother has been playing it and he keeps talking about how good it is but I can’t get into it. It’s just too much to do and there are too many options.  I like games that have story and direction, not so open ended. So what games should I play?

title: New idea for a new game mode?
self_text: So I was thinking, what if there was a game mode where you could play as an NPC/Villager and have to survive the night from mobs? You can do all kinds of things like barricade your house with wood or make weapons out of whatever is in the village. And after surviving the night, you get a reward of sorts for helping the villagers!  What do you guys think about it?

title: Best looking character in the game?
self_text: I think that's definitely the most attractive and badass woman in the whole series!

title: I need help with a modded character build
self_text: So I'm trying to make a character for my next playthrough, but I can't think of something that is fun and works well together.  I want it to be like a crazy powerful build.  I have some ideas on the skills but I don't know what race or class to pick.  Any suggestions?

title: Why is it so hard to get a good job?
self_text: I'm 28 years old and have been applying for jobs for 4 months now. I have no experience but have an associate degree in art and design, and just finished a bootcamp on web development.  I've applied for over 100 jobs at this point and gotten around 3 interviews which all didn't end up going anywhere.  Why is it so hard to find work as a young adult with limited skills??

title: How do I get my items to show up on the item store?
self_text: I've been trying for a while now and no matter what, it won't let me upload them. Do they have to be of a certain type or size? Any help is appreciated!

title: I'm sorry but the new season is terrible so far
self_text: I am not saying it's a bad season, but it feels very uninspired and there are no interesting matchups yet. The only thing that has been good is the first week of ranked play with everyone playing different champions trying to find their place in the meta, but now we have gotten into the boring part where people just pick the same champions over and over again.  I hope they can add some more interesting changes or content to make the season feel fresh.

title: Question for the devs - will there be a way to track how many times we’ve defeated bosses?
self_text: I just realised that there is no way to know how many times you have beaten a boss in game.  I would love it if we could see statistics on each boss like; number of attempts, time spent fighting, total damage dealt etc. It might give people more incentive to keep replaying the game and trying different builds.

title: What do you think of the upcoming changes to Ranked?
self_text: I've been thinking about this for a bit and have some thoughts. I think that it will be good in some ways but also bad in others, and I wanted to see what other people thought.  I personally am a big fan of getting more ranked play time so I like the fact that there is less of a time commitment to get into ranked. But I don't know how well this is going to work with the current matchmaking system and I worry it could lead to more unbalanced matches.

title: Can you make a story about a teenage boy with telekinetic powers?
self_text: I want it to be like a movie script and there should be something mysterious happening in the background.  It's ok if there are plot holes but they have to be filled later on.
